number of helpful: 7 of 26 people (27%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 9, 2014
												While I used to like this game, and was somewhat good at it, I can no longer play it. The recent patch made a huge improvement in grafics, and added the last class of the original game to the line-up (namely the Man-at-Arms), but it also caused the game to be unplayable for those who don't have a computer made for games. Before the patch, the grafics were somewhat bad, but the game ran smooth and worked without problems. But now, the new grafics causes a lag which makes your attacks miss. If you have a older computer, or a computer not optimized for games, don't bother with this game. I give the game before the patch 9/10 and the game after the patch 5/10.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2014
												Sloppy coding, incompetent developed decisions, SEVERELY unbalanced class design (as the oodles and oodles and oodles of map and weapon changes over the years have tried desperately to make not AS bad, but you just can't fix something that wasn't meant to be made in the first place), over-abundance of unnecessary community splicing (I.E. giving some players access to a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ beta while ignoring the rest when in fact what was being "beta-tested" was releasable in terms of the terrible quality the mod already had going for it anyway), and a HEARTY amount of community theft. Stealing maps from ex-devs who left years ago, but claiming it a NEW map (check the REAL author for tortuga and when it was made, you will find it was created around 6 years before it was actually released as a "new map"), constantly desperate to take maps made by the community and make them official so the dev team can avoid doing any real work, even if said maps don't fit the theme in the slightest, or are fugly as hell and need dozens of revisions (which plenty of the official maps already get anyway which says a lot about their confidence in the first place) and to top it all off, the dev team has had a LOAD of behind-the-scenes drama with each other AND its own community. The biggest of these countless examples would probably be them giving the finger to the ORIGINAL CREATOR OF PIRATES, VIKINGS AND KNIGHTS on the goldsource engine, ultimately showing zero respect for authors of ACTUAL creativity (as is still practiced by them with their map theft and content-copying) considering the majority of everything created was based off of someone else's work, including multiple maps, biggest example obviously being bt_island. Avoid this♥♥♥♥♥♥at all costs. It is garbage, and is made by the embodiment of quite the same. Anyone who has gotten cozy with this mod for longer than a year prior will know this very well, and thati s why its playerbase has died off for very very VERY good reasons.

content:
Posted: May 6, 2015
												Pirates, Vikings, and Knights 2. The source mod that changed everything.I've been playing this mod since before the steam release, far before the beautiful new updates with cool new classes and maps, and I gotta say, the deal is just getting sweeter and sweeter. First and foremost, it has always been a free game, and will most likely always be so. Secondly, the gameplay is frantic, fast-paced, fun and addictive. And last, but not least, the content creators are still active after 8 odd years, and still pushing out great content. With a supportive community, active creators and a funny sense of humor, I have to recommend this game to anyone who wishes to play a fun, free fps. 10/10.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 11, 2013
												!UPDATE!    After playing the new updates I will re-review the game and keep my old one posted at the bottom. The last time I reviewed this was prior to the MAA release and at a time when development seemed dead or stagnant.  It seems the devs are more coordinated now with more updates lately then in the last few years, so that is a positive.  Hopefully they got rid of anyone who was hindering the progress and kept the talent.                                       So PVK II finally has the men-at-arms.    Well I am happy the guys have finally sorted that one out after some years and I do enjoy the character.   He is what I would consider an all around character.  He can fight/defend well and has a crossbow for ranged attacks.  I would say he doesn't necessarily shine at anything but he is solid on all fronts.  I enjoy the wacky voice for him but some may find it annoying.  A new mechanic was added which is a roll/dodge.  Now I am glad they added a new mechanic and it shows they got some new ideas pumping through their heads.  I personally find it not practical(imo) to use in a fight because it slows you down tremendously and leaves you open for attack as you exit the roll.  I still think its more effective to keep your speed up and jump around but I do enjoy the choice of having it. You can also kick now, which I enjoy a lot because it's to much fun to kick someone to their death in pvk.   I enjoy the new parrot colors, thats was a good idea on their part.  Also alot fo classic maps have been revamped which is a good thing.  (The knights have a spawn now in Island!)  My favorite one is the new SDK update for the game which was widely anticipated because of the general overall improvement it would have on the game.                     I know I was harsh towards this game but I reserve that right.   I am glad they are working on it more again and I hope to see it finish one day.  The game has a low playerbase but we could always use more people t join us.  You may look at this game and think it looks strange but no matter what bad I could say it is still my most played steam game ever(possibly more than anything else I have ever played too) It's like an addiction I can't shake,  I always come back.   So I will upvote it for now because it seems like they are rolling the wheels again in the right direction.  Now lets hope a few years don't pass and nothing happens ;)                                                          !OLD REVIEW!             After playing this game for years I have to change my upvote to a down vote.   This game isn't going anywhere unfortunately.  I am sure the MAA will come out sometime in a few years or next tuesday and after that I wouldn't be suprised if development stopped in its already dead in the water pace.       Yes the devs have their own life but this game has been around for a LONG time.  I wouldn't necessarily call them a dev team its more of a clik. Meaning only "certain" peoples opinion are considered valuable and the rest meh.  On the actual forums I have seen threads questioning the devs on "What exactly are you guys doing for said game?"  Since we get no feedback on their progress or what they happen to be working on.   After a dev lists a few excuses to the questioning community and then locks the thread because "Hey! We don't want you to question us on how to program our game."            Gameplay wise though its a barrel of fun for what has been accomplished.  You of course have your three teams.  It makes for some hilariously fun matchs and good laughs.   Also we have some great people to play with, also there are a-holes but hey what can you do(mute button is appropriate for that).    I wanna recommend this game. I really do but whats going to happen is we get an influx of new players.  The regulars destroy them(some tough it out and get better but most leave)  and when the new players want to know where the game is going... well read the second paragraph.          Don't get me wrong I love this game but its pipe dream now.   I do recommend trying it out to see if you will like it on your own terms but don't expect the game to go anywhere.   Peace love and chicken grease!

												Answers the old-age question: which savage reigns supreme? PVKII is a really interesting mod, even after a decade. Plus with TF2 coming with the Source SDK for free, there is absolutely no excuse not to play it at least once.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 19, 2010
												To many players, the title was all it took. It's still in progress so balance is not finely tuned, and it can be frustrating when other players take teams x and y first leaving the game unbalanced or you stuck with team z for the tenth game in a row ... ballacing is a lot more complicated with three teams than with two. But the melee combat is excellant, with a nice, simple attack/block mechanic. And there are attack parrots. I don't think any other game has attack parrots, vikiing Seaxes and castles in one little package. Multiplayer only, but loads of fun.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 25, 2016
												Free. Amusing. Entertaining. These are just some words to describe this game. But in spite of being completely free of charge with no hidden fees included, this game is all but gratuitous. I have been playing this game casually, every now and then, for the past 10 years now, and I have got to say that this game is probably one of the funniest video games that I have ever played in my entire life. The voices of the characters, the absurdness of the teams available - pirates, vikings, and knights - of which only the knights and the pirates would have realistically fought each other (albeit not in 13th Century harnesses with greatswords against 18th Century blunderbusses wielded by pirates), and the entire atmosphere of the game all make Pirates, Vikings, and Knights II a game that keeps on being enjoyable, year after year.However, Pirates, Vikings, and Knights II has been in development for over ten years now. This is something that may be considered as a good thing, because it shows dedication and persistence from the development team, but it may also be considered as a minus, because the development of PVKII has been rather slow in the past decade. All of the classes that have been intended to be included in the game have not been finished, yet, and there is currently no ETA on when the rest of the classes will be implemented. There are also some balancing issues with some of the classes in the teams. For example, the Man-At-Arms of the Knights has been criticized for being too overpowered against his enemies, mainly due to his surprisingly long-lasting and powerful special attack that leaves the opposing players, first of all, very dead, but also in an unblissful awe of how childish and lame the Man-At-Arm's special attack is.But in spite of the minor class balancing issues and historical inaccuracies, or maybe because of them, Pirates, Vikings, and Knights II is still an epic video game that continues to lure in new players, perhaps out of curiousity, even though the game has been around for over a decade.

But in spite of being completely free of charge with no hidden fees included, this game is all but gratuitous. I have been playing this game casually, every now and then, for the past 10 years now, and I have got to say that this game is probably one of the funniest video games that I have ever played in my entire life. The voices of the characters, the absurdness of the teams available - pirates, vikings, and knights - of which only the knights and the pirates would have realistically fought each other (albeit not in 13th Century harnesses with greatswords against 18th Century blunderbusses wielded by pirates), and the entire atmosphere of the game all make Pirates, Vikings, and Knights II a game that keeps on being enjoyable, year after year.However, Pirates, Vikings, and Knights II has been in development for over ten years now. This is something that may be considered as a good thing, because it shows dedication and persistence from the development team, but it may also be considered as a minus, because the development of PVKII has been rather slow in the past decade. All of the classes that have been intended to be included in the game have not been finished, yet, and there is currently no ETA on when the rest of the classes will be implemented. There are also some balancing issues with some of the classes in the teams. For example, the Man-At-Arms of the Knights has been criticized for being too overpowered against his enemies, mainly due to his surprisingly long-lasting and powerful special attack that leaves the opposing players, first of all, very dead, but also in an unblissful awe of how childish and lame the Man-At-Arm's special attack is.But in spite of the minor class balancing issues and historical inaccuracies, or maybe because of them, Pirates, Vikings, and Knights II is still an epic video game that continues to lure in new players, perhaps out of curiousity, even though the game has been around for over a decade.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 13, 2016
												Been playing this game on and off for a few years. It's getting on in years but is hands down one of the best standalone Souce mods out there. It still has a small, but active community, and whilst some of them may be a bit... interesting, you will be made to feel welcome. Very rare to see any drama in this game, although kids will be kids and being a free game and all it has it's fair share.The gameplay is easy to understand for a new player, just remember to capture the chests and attack the team with the most chests and you will be sailing (no pun intended). Games are split between 3 teams, Pirates, Vikings and Knights (obviously), so new players can tend to get confused as to who to attack, but like I said, attack the team winning.Combat is different depending on which team and class you choose. The Pirates have the super quick Skirmisher, the high DPS slow paced Captain, and the Sharpshooter, a low health class armed with a long range musket. The Vikings have the low armor Bezerker capable of high damage but with little versatality, the Gestir, armed with a spear and throwing javelins (a very versatile class and my personal favourite) and the Huscarl, a highly armored axe wielder which is a great class for a new player in my opinion. The Knights have the Archer, which is self explanatory and has probably the highest skill ceiling in the game. A great archer is a force to be reckoned with. The knight is the tank of the team and the game really, highly armored and capable of heavy damage but slow. The Man at Arms is French, quick and farts.In short this game is definitely worth a gander if you like the idea of fun melee fest with a couple of old timey muskets thrown in for good measure. If Chivalry is too grim and muddy give this a whirl for a different kind of melee experience.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 18, 2016
												Lets get right down to the squire.PVK is a silly melee multiplayer mod for HL2. Because what isn't a half life 2 mod these days?!  Much like Super Smash Bros or Goldeneye64, this game has potential for lots of fun and laughs amongst a group of friends. Each team of Vikings, pirates and knights has 3 classes that mix up gameplay and offer somehting for everyone. The game is jammed full of funny action phrases and achievements. The players you find on this game will be a lot of fun to play with. For a free game, this offers a fun experience and alternative to your whacky action multiplayers.Hit boxes, class balance and weapon damage are a total headache though(ruining the longevity for competitive players when the novelty wears off), so keep in mind it may not be for everyone. In my opinion it was worth the try and fun to play for a little bit.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 9, 2011
												The second strangest mod concept ever thought up, next to Bubba Lego-Tep. Seriously though; this mod differs greatly from most other strange 'n' wacky mods in one huge aspect: it actually delivers a solid gameplay experience. It's not asymmetrical in any way that you'd likely expect - rather, it goes for a system based off of each team's classes playing off each other. Which is interesting, given that classes are still being implemented into the game. Anyways, yeah; with a unique approach to first person melee combat that I find even more satisfying than games such as Chivalry, and a solid class system that manages to be both balanced and chaotic at the same time, this mod has easily become one of my favorite multiplayer mods of all time. If a PVKIII were to be developed on a modern engine like Unreal 4, I have a feeling that it'd see a good deal of popularity.

Posted: August 3, 2016
												Pirates, Vikings, and Knights II or PVK2 for short is a melee FPS like no other. It has a variety of modes, including deathmatch, booty, and control points. It's a lot like Team Fortress II in terms of humor and art style and that's what will make this game enjoyable. And it's free. Not many people know about this game but it still has a thriving community that constantly keeps servers busy. PVK2 is the most own melee FPS that even players who aren't familiar with the title and the mode will enjoy and make a great addition to their Steam Library.
